io.ddf.content

Interface IHandleRepresentations

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IHandleDDFFunctionalGroup
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RepresentationHandler, RepresentationHandler

    public interface IHandleRepresentations
extends IHandleDDFFunctionalGroup

    Handles the underlying, implementation-specific representation(s) of a DDF. Note that a single DDF may have simultaneously multiple representations, all of which are expected to be equivalent in terms of relevant content value. Contrast this with, e.g., IHandleViews, which results in entirely new DDFs with different columns or rows. These new DDFs are logically referred to as new "views".

    For example, a DDF may initially be represented as an RDD[TablePartition]. But in order to send it to a machine-learning algorithm, an RDD[LabeledPoint] representation is needed. An IHandleRepresentations is expected to help perform this transformation, and it may still hold on to both representations, until they are somehow invalidated.

    In another example, a DDF may be mutated in a transformation from one RDD to a new RDD. It should automatically keep track of the reference to the new RDD, so that to the client of DDF, it properly appears to have been mutated. This makes it possible to for DDF to support R-style replacement functions. The underlying RDDs are of course immutable.

    As a final example, a DDF may be set up to accept incoming streaming data. The client has a constant reference to this DDF, but the underlying data is constantly being updated, such that each query against this DDF would result in different data being returned/aggregated.

      • set

        void set(Object data,
       Class<?>... typeSpecs)
        Clears all current representations and set it to the supplied one.
        Parameters:
        data -
        typeSpecs - a variable-length array of specifications to identify the exact data representation type, e.g., RDD> would be (RDD.class, List.class, Double.class). If not provided, the handler should do its best to infer from the data object.
